info.senderName: NWS El Paso Tx/Santa Teresa NM
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 28 at 5:26PM MDT until September 28 at 8:45PM MDT by NWS El Paso Tx/Santa Teresa NM
info.description:
FFWEPZ
The National Weather Service in El Paso Tx/Santa Teresa has extended the
* Flash Flood Warning for... Northeastern El Paso County in western Texas...
* Until 845 PM MDT.
* At 526 PM MDT, Texas Park and Wildlife confirmed thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring.
HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms.
SOURCE...Emergency management reported.
IMPACT...Flash flooding of arroyos, urban areas, highways, and streets as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas.
* Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Hueco Tanks State Park, Hueco Mountain Estates, Butterfield and Homestead Meadows.
Roads in and around State Park Road near Hueco Tanks are currently impassable due to flooding. Avoid flooded roads.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
